result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick M Arrowood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Arrowood

records.addlTxt: of intent to certify debt to the Wisconsin Dept. of Revenue - copy mailed to Def.
Def's NOC,JU,NEJ mailed
(Copy given to jail)

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CM147 and 17CF76 @ 10:34 a.m. SAR on cts 1 & 2 on16CM147 and sentencing on cts 2-6 on 17CF76. State has reviewed both revocation packet and PSI, notes only one correction regarding date of hrg. Atty Kirkpatrick has reviewed both documents w/Def, no additions or corrections. Joint recommendation - stip to Dept's recommendation on each. 16CM147 -  1 yr jail on each ct, concurrent, 399 days credit, time served. 17CF76 - ct 2 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 2 yrs es, imposed & stayed, 3 yrs probation, 9 months conditional jail. Ct 3 - 30 days jail, concurrent to ct 2. Ct 4 - 9 months jail, concurrent. Ct 5 - 9 months jail, concurrent. Ct 6 - 9 months jail, concurrent. Court costs. State asks for AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations. State also asks for condition of maintain work/school fulltime upon release on supervision, with Def free to argue. State believes no credit for time served. Def does not object. Further sentencing remarks by the State. Sentencing remarks by Atty Kirkpatrick. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. Orders 16CM147 ct 1 - 1 yr jail, credit for 399 days, time served. Convert any remaining obligations to civil judgment. Ct 2 - same as ct 1, 1 yr jail, concurrent, credit for 399 days, time served, civil judgment. State has complied with VWNR. Orders on 17CF76 Ct 2 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 months initial, 2 yrs ext supv, imposed & stayed, 3 yrs probation - 9 months cond jail, starting today, huber, AODA, maintain full time work 30 hrs/wk or applying for at least 5 jobs/wk that qualified for. Court costs, DNA surcharge $250, DNA sample if not already on file. No credit for time served. Ct 3 - 30 days jail, concurrent to ct 2, court costs, DNA surcharge waived. Ct 4 - 9 months jail, concurrent with ct 2, all jail is concurrent, huber on all cts. Ct 5 - 9 months jail, concurrent, huber, court costs. Ct 6 - 9 months jail, concurrent, huber. DNA surcharge waived on cts 3-6. Def eligible for SAP and CIP. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Costs on all counts to be paid as condition of probation.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 18, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court, in custody with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Courtney Imig, intern.  Court calls 16CM147, 17CF76 & 17CM75  @ 2:11 pm. State gives plea agreement, 17CF76 Information sent electronically and defense given copy, 17CF76 ct 1 DRI, ct 2 2nd offense enhancer deleted, plea, ct's 3-6 plea, 17CM75 DRI, 17CF76 PSI, caps at 4 year initial confinement.  16CM147 SAR will be heard on sentencing date.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights & J.T. filed.  Waiver of preliminary examination filed. 17CF76 Def. waives preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Kirkpatrick has copy of information and waives reading.  Def. understands charges and penalties. 17CF76 Ct 2 Poss of Meth, repeater, ptac, no contest plea, ct 3 Poss of Drg Paraph, repeater, ptac, no contest, ct 4 Resisting repeater, no contest plea, ct 5 criminal damage, repeater, no contest, ct 6 resisting, repeater, no contest plea.   Court grants State motions to DRI ct 1 in 17CF76 and 17CM75 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Def. admits prior convictions. Atty Kirkpatrick is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis on 17CF76, accept pleas and finds def. Guilty to Ct 2 Poss of Meth, repeater, ptac, Ct 3 Poss of Drg Paraph, ptac, repeater Ct 4 Resisting, repeater, Ct 5 Criminal Damage to property, repeater & Ct 6 Resisting, repeater.   Court orders PSI on 17CF76. Ct 2 Court will delete 2nd offense enhancer.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for May 3, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 31, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CM147, 17CF76 and 17CM75 @2:28 p.m. State has made offer on all. Def is rejecting so State withdraws offer, makes statement regarding bond on 17CF76. Atty Kirkpatrick advises, would like to wait on sentence after revocation to try to resolve all. 17CF76 - Copy of complaint received, reading waived, time limits for prelim waived. Court explains prelim rights, finds waiver knowing & voluntary. Off the record for scheduling sentencing after revocation on 16CM147 and status conf/possible plea/sent on 17CF76 and 17CM75.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM270 @ 3:00 Parties have received revocation summary. Brief recess 3:05. Resume 3:07. Court has reviewed revocation summary. No additions or corrections by parties. State gives recommendation - ct 1 - 225 days jail, ct 2 - 225 days jail, concurrent. Atty Schuster agrees. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Will approve agreement. Ct 1 - 225 days jail. Ct 2 - 225 days jail, concurrent to ct 1. 67 days sentence credit. Civil judgment for court obligations. Huber. Request by Atty Schuster regarding huber. Court orders huber as allowed by jail. 

3:20 Court calls 16CM107, 16CM147, 16CM134 and 16CM135. Statement of negotiated plea filed. Agreement stated 16CM107- plea to ct 1, 15 days jail consecutive to 15CM270, court costs, ct 2 dismiss and read in. No sentence credit. 16CM147 ct s 1 & 2 withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, comply with orders in Langlade Co case 16JC19, costs. Cts 3 & 4 and 16CM134 and 16CM135 dismissed and read in. No sentence credit in 16CM147. Atty Schuster and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. 16CM107 ct 1 - guilty plea. 16CM147 ct 1 - guilty plea, 16CM147 ct 2 - guilty plea. Cts 3 & 4 dismissed and read in. 16CM107 ct 2 dismissed and read in. 16CM134 and 16CM135 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 16CM107 ct 1, 16CM147 cts 1 & 2. Sentencing remarks by State. Court questions counsel about condition of probation. Sentencing remarks by Atty Schuster. Nothing by Defendant. 16CM107 ct 1 - Court approves agreement. 15 days jail consecutive to 15CM270, huber. No credit for time served. Court costs including DNA surcharge. Pmt plan. First pmt due in October. 16CM147 Court approves agreement. Ct 1 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required. No credit for time served. Court will not order compliance with chips order as condition of probation, gives reasons. Court costs. DNA surcharge. Ct 2 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, same conditions as ct 1. No credit for time served. Def believes has already given DNA sample, form still completed.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.
Bail Bond - see 16CM107

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court  via video, with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CM107, 16CM134, 16CM135 and 16CM147.  Statement by Atty Schuster in regards to bond.  Request to amend to signature bond.  Response by State.  Court will amend.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.   Bond will cover all files.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody. Court will receive not guilty pleas.  Bond will continues  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CM134, 16CM135 and New complaint @ 2:27 p.m. Warrant in 16CM135. Court reviews new charges and possible penalties. Court vacates warrant. State heard on bond. Court questions Def on ability to post bond. Def explains why he missed Court. Court sets bond to cover these three files. Bond in 16CM107 remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
